t: Psalm 33
Sing*pn joyfully to the Lord,*s you righteous; it*ld is fitting for the upright to praise him.
Praise*ln the Lord*s with the harp; make*ld music to him on the ten-stringed lyre.
Sing*ln to him a new song; play*ld skillfully, and shout for joy.
For*pn the word of the Lord*s is right and true; he*ld is faithful in all he does.
The*ln Lord*s loves righteousness and justice; the*ld earth is full of his unfailing love.
By*pn the word of the Lord*s the heavens were made, their*ld starry host by the breath of his mouth.
He*ln gathers the waters of the sea into jars; he*ld puts the deep into storehouses.
Let*ln all the earth fear the Lord;*s let*ld all the people of the world revere him.
For*ln he spoke, and it came to be; he*ld commanded, and it stood firm.
The*pn Lord*s foils the plans of the nations; he*ld thwarts the purposes of the peoples.
But*ln the plans of the Lord*s stand firm forever, the*ld purposes of his heart through all generations.
Blessed*pn is the nation whose God is the Lord,*s the*ld people he chose for his inheritance.
From*ln heaven the Lord*s looks down and*ld sees all mankind;
from*ln his dwelling place he watches all*ld who live on earthâ€”
he*ln who forms the hearts of all, who*ld considers everything they do.
No*pn king is saved by the size of his army; no*ld warrior escapes by his great strength.

But*ln the eyes of the Lord*s are on those who fear him, on*ld those whose hope is in his unfailing love,
to*ln deliver them from death and*ld keep them alive in famine.
